sections.title: APPENDIX B : MUC-5 TEST SCORE S This appendix contains the summary score reports for each system on the MUC-5 evaluation . The reports are ordered by language/domain (EJV, JJV, EME, JME) and secondarily by site (in alphabetical order). Deeper investigation into system performance may be done on the basis of template-by-template scor e reports, which detail the performance of the system on each article in the test set . The template-by-template score reports are not included in this appendix . A brief introduction to reading the score reports is presented here . Some information on the performance metrics may also be found in the paper, "Tipster/MUC-5 Information Extraction System Evaluation" by B . Sundheim in this volume . Further description of the score report and further definition and explanation of the scoring categories and performance metrics may be found in this volume in the paper titled "MUC-5 Evaluatio n Metrics" by N. Chinchor and B . Sundheim . The first column in the report, SLOT, contains one of the following three types of label: A slot name, e.g ., conten t An object name, e .g ., <template> The word "subtotals " Of the three types of rows, the one of primary interest is the one labeled with a slot name . The rows labeled with an object name may be disregarded. The rows containing subtotals may be of interest to those interested in performance on the various types of objects in the template . The following tallies for the test set are presented in columns in the score reports : POS \t Number possible (= COR+PAR+INC+MIS), i .e., the number of fills a system should generate. This value is somewhat variable among systems because of alternative cardinalities of slot fills allowed for in the answer key . ACT \t Number "actual" (= COR+PAR+INC+SPU), i .e., the number of fills generated by the system under evaluation C OR \t Number correct PAR \t Number partially correct IN C \t Number incorrect S P U \t Number spuriou s MIS \t Number missing NON \t Number " noncommittal ," i.e., number of null slot fills generated by system, where the fill is also null in the answer ke y The rightmost columns in the report contain the scores for the following extraction metrics : ERR Error per response fill = ( .SPAR+INC+SPU+MIS)/(COR+PAR+INC+SPU+MIS ) UND Undergeneration = MIS/P O S OV G Overgeneration = SPU/AC T SUB Substitution = ( .SPAR+INC)/(COR+PAR+INC ) REC Recall = (COR+ .5PAR)/PO S PRE Precision = (COR+ .SPAR)/ACT None of the above metrics includes the NON scoring category in its computation . Readers who wish to consider noncommittal fills to be correct may revise the formulas by including NON in all denominators and i n those numerators where COR appears . Note, however, that the high undergeneration scores obtained by mos t systems on many slots in the evaluation places in question the value of considering noncommittal fills to b e correct . 36 2 The first two rows at the bottom of the report are the ALL-OBJECTS and MATCHED-ONLY rows . These offer two options in the way the ERR, UND, OVG, SUB, REC, and PRE scores are computed . ALL-OBJECTS gives the official overall tallies and overall ERR, UND, OVG, SUB, REC, and PRE scores. The tallies in POS, ACT, COR, PAR, INC, SPU, MIS, and NON columns add up to the ALL-OBJECTS values, but not all rows are considered. The rows that are not considered arc th e object rows (i.e ., those where the entry in the SLOT column is an object name), the subtotal rows (sinc e they simply sum up the tallies for the scored slots in each object), and the following slot rows in th e <template> object: doc-nr, doc-date, and doc-source (these appear only in the EJV and JJV full - template reports). MATCHED-ONLY contains tallies and scores given a method of scoring that eliminates slot-fil l penalties in the case where the system under evaluation failed to generate an expected object and in the cas e where it generated a spurious object . The tallies in the slot rows do not sum up to the totals contained in the MATCHED-ONLY row . The scores for the metrics in the ALL-OBJECTS and MATCHED-ONLY rows are not computed by averaging the scores in the individual slot rows, but instead are computed on the basis of the tally totals containe d in the ALL-OBJECTS or MATCHED-ONLY row. The remaining rows at the bottom of the report contain scores for the following metrics : TEXT-FILTERING \t\t Text filtering (document detection ) RICHNESS-NORMALIZED-ERROR Richness-normalized error (normalized version o f error per response fill) ERROR-RATE-PER-WORD \t Error rate per word F-MEASURES \t F-measures (weighted combination of recall an d precision) The formulation of each of the above metrics is described below. Text-filtering scores are computed on the basis of relevant/nonrelevant decisions made by th e system for the text as a whole, not on the basis of tallies in the slot rows . Some of the score category columns are used to contain the tallies for these decisions across the test set : COR (decides relevan t and relevant is correct), SPU (decides relevant and nonrelevant is correct), MIS (decides nonrelevan t and relevant is correct), and NON (decides nonrelevant and nonrelevant is correct) . Text-filtering formulas are therefore as follows : REC = COR/(COR+MIS); PRE = COR/(COR+SPU) ; UN D = MIS/(COR+MIS); OVG = SPU/(COR+SPU) . Two values of richness-normalized error are computed . The formulas are as follows : Min-err = Wrong/All-fills, Max-err = Wrong/Req-fills . There will be a range of fill counts from the minimum number of fills required (Req-fills) to the maximum number of fills allowed (All-fills) , according to the answer key . These values are almost, but not quite, system-independent . Error rate per word is computed as Wrong/Word-count . The scores for Japanese are no t accurate . F-measure scores corresponding to three different weightings of precision relative to recall arc computed. The P&R value weights precision the same as recall ; the 2P&R value gives twice th e weight to precision ; the P&2R value weights precision half as much as recall . The general formul a is F = ((3 2+1 .0)xPxR/(6 2xP)+R, where is the weighting factor . 363 EJV Summary Scores BBN PLUM Syste m 1 . Full-Template Test SLOT PIS
